p: The number of liver cancer patients increased from 349 127 (prevalence: 28.22/100 000, AR: 38.64/100 000) in 1997 to 814 026 (prevalence: 60.04/100 000, AR: 53.18/100 000) in 2016. The number of new cases increased from 338 063 (incidence: 27.33/100 000, AR: 37.55/100 000) to 561 249 (incidence: 41.40/100 000, AR: 36.62/100 000). There were 338 904 deaths (27.40/100 000, AR: 38.03/100 000) in 1997 and 426 900 deaths (31.49/100 000, AR: 27.73/100 000) in 2016. The DALYs also increased from 10 311 308 (rate: 833.52/100 000, AR: 1104.65/100 000) in 1997 to 11 539 102 (rate: 851.16/100 000, AR: 759.02/100 000) in 2016 ( figure 1 and online supplementary table 1). There were increasing trends from 1997 to 2016 in prevalence (AAPC: 4.0%, 95% CI 3.9% to 4.2%), incidence (AAPC: 2.1%, 95% CI 2.0% to 2.2%) and mortality (AAPC: 0.5%, 95% CI 0.2% to 0.9%), while the rate of DALYs remained stable (AAPC: −0.1%, 95% CI −0.4% to 0.3%). The APC increased for prevalence since 2009, for incidence since 2010, and for mortality and rate of DALYs since 2013 ( table 1 and online supplementary figure 1).
